intro: Sebastiania rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in shaded, humid environments. The plant is characterized by its rounded, fleshy leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule containing numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Sebastiania rotundifolia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance.
